level.text: Common space shall be accessible to the occupants of every dwelling unit for which such space is provided without the necessity of going through another habitation.
Water closets, showers, and bathtubs shall be located in a room or compartment which affords privacy to a person within that room or compartment.
Bathrooms or sleeping rooms shall be accessible to the occupants of rooming units without the necessity of the occupants going through any of the following:
A sleeping room which is part of another habitation; or

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: The Housing Regulations of the District of Columbia, 5G DCRR § 2307, Commissioners’ Order 55-1503 (August 11, 1955).
